text: Previously on Dance Moms...
I just take Kelly back.
I know, that's the plan.
Girls, where are you?
I'm going to replace the entire team!
They are replacing... our kids.
If we don't win, then those mothers will have their last...
You have to win!
Do you want to be there for Miss Abby?
Yeah!
Nowhere else to go.
Second is not good enough for the Abby Lee Dance Company!
Thank God for you, Sophia. Thank God!
Coming up on Dance Moms'
Well, well, well...
While you all were at the parking lot
Sophia was in here!
Sophia!
You were doing your solo...
I think she is fabulous!
...quite, she is gonna beat our kids every time...
Maddie, I think before Sophia was here
you hit those accents.
You just seem like, a daylight a dollar short.
Chloe is a product of you.
Chloe was awful today!
What are we do to our kids?
âª Get up, get on the floor âª
âª My world is with my girls âª
âª Livin' on the dance floor. âª
âª âª

speaker: SOPHIA
text: Hello! ABBY LEE: Hi, sweetie, how are you?
Go ahead in. You can start warming up.

speaker: ABBY
text: Last week was really tough.
I pulled a replacement team in.
Hi.
Go ahead right through into the den, and the girls can start stretching.
Even though we got second, I would much rather work with these kids.
Pretty soon, those old moms will just be a distant memory.
Real dance moms are here.
Melissa's a high-maintenance friend.
Well...
I realize now that the way Abby treats my girls is never gonna change.
But they miss the studio, and they even miss Abby.
I know the last person Abby wants to see is me,
but the other moms won't come back without me,
and all of our girls are dying to be at dance again.
You're part of the team.
That's the whole point of this whole thing.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: It's great that Kelly wants to be back on the team.
The problem is, it's too late. Abby's replaced us.
And now we have to go crawling back to Abby, begging her to take us all back.
I'm not signing a thing until your name is on it and you're walking through the door.
And I think we all need to stick to that.
Hi, Shelly? This is Abby.
It's about a half an hour into rehearsal, and I don't have Ally.
She is not the kind of kid that's gonna be late.
I'm calling to find out where Ally is. She was supposed to be here at 4:00.
She is in New Orleans!
All the way back home.
How did this get screwed up?
Your daughter came in second place--
probably the reason the team came in second place--
and now she's gonna come in and be mad,
and you're just like, "It's all good."
Ally could not be blamed for that group dance.
She was magnificent.
Give my best to Ally.

speaker: ABBY
text: They were blaming her
for the group dance coming in second? Crazy.
Oh, my God. Here we go again.
Same old story.
Jealousy is an ugly disease.
You can ask Christi.
Girls... go head into the studio A, start warming up in there.
I just got off the phone with Shelly.
She said, "Those other two mothers
"were telling my kid that she was the reason we lost the group."
No.
This is my livelihood. This is what I do.
I don't have a husband that has a million-dollar job.
I don't... I don't do that.
And the kid cried all the way home.
These moms pushed one of my best dancers out.

speaker: ABBY
text: You know what? No more Mrs. Nice Guy.
It's over.
You two... are out.
Glo, Marcia... Poof! Be gone.
[crying] Why do we have to leave?
Mom? You guys are the one that blamed it.
Just don't fight.
We want to stay. [sniffs]
Apologize. Go say sorry.
We did.
We want this really badly, Mom.

speaker: ABBY
text: I can't believe this has all happened.
I am left with one member
of the Abby Lee Dance Company Elite Competition Team.
âª âª
All right, we'll take off now.

speaker: ABBY
text: You are the only one left.
So when we go away this weekend, you need to win your division
and you need to win the entire competition.
I don't want to piss her off more... me walking in.

speaker: MELISSA
text: See, you're dying.
I'm dying. I think we need to go... let's move along.
This is stupid.

speaker: KELLY
text: Abby basically blames me for the team falling apart.
So I think if I stay outside, we'll have a better chance at reconciliation.
- What are they doing? - Oh, my God.
I can't believe the same moms who quit for Kelly and her two kids
are back in my parking lot again.
But you know what? I just might have some openings.
- Ladies. - [quietly] Contact.
You come in and dance or you leave.
You don't loiter in the parking lot.
Are we being invited in? Can we come in now?
If you want to come, the door is open.
- JILL: All right, let's go. - I'll come in. I'll walk with you.
This isn't a church, Holly, it's a dance studio.

speaker: HOLLY
text: I got God all on my side.
He comes with me wherever I go.
Yeah, you got God on your thighs, too.
The moms quitting was their choice.
They're quitters, that's what they do. That wasn't my choice.
They walked out of here, and if they think...
...that they're gonna walk back in, they have another thing coming.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Each year, Abby has us sign this stupid contract
that locks us in for a year.
And in that year, you can't leave her studio, you know, short of death.
You will not get past this front desk without these being signed.
Where's Kelly's?
Kelly called me names, Kelly quit,
Kelly boo-hooed, and her kids are lazy slugs!

speaker: JILL
text: We feel that Kelly is a part of our team.
Jill, did you come here because Kelly's kids were here?
You want to be loyal to somebody, it should be me.
This is the hardest thing for me, because my kids want to dance,
and I don't know how long I can hold off.
You took Maddie and put her on the same level as the rest of those kids.
We didn't. We worked our butts off with your kids.
Make a decision.
Well, I brought Kendall here to dance.
I need her to dance, I want her to dance.
That's my decision.

speaker: ABBY
text: Finished.
Make a decision right now.
You either choose the Abby Lee Dance Company,
or you can go play with Brooke and Paige.
âª âª
Well, my kids are not gonna be playing.
They're gonna be dancing.

speaker: HOLLY
text: I... I'm disappointed in Melissa and Jill.
We had worked so hard.
It was like all of that was in vain.
Time is ticking, ladies.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: At this point, I think Holly and I have really done as much as we can do.
We have said we're not going back in without Kelly, and Abby's like,
"So? Don't let the door hit you in the ass on the way out."
All right, let's do it.
Okay. Give us the contract.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: I think Kelly needs to go in and fight for herself and her daughters.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: So if Kelly comes to you,
and they say that they want to be back on this team, you would listen?
I would certainly listen to them.

speaker: KELLY
text: I just want today to be the last day for this.
She made us sign the contract.

speaker: KELLY
text: I am gonna go in there, and I am gonna get my kids back on the team.
- Hi, Kelly, how are you? - Good. How are you?
So why do you want to come back? You hate it here.
I don't want to come back. My kids want to come back.
And every single mother in the group, and kid in the group, wants us here.
You called me a whore, you made fun of my weight,
you gave me the finger.
And you called my kids stupid.
They are. They make dumb choices.
Abby, I don't want to argue with you anymore.
I want you to get over the [bleep]
that happened with us 30 years ago,
and treat my kids like you treat everybody else in this studio.
That's what I want.
Well, I don't want your kids to be mediocre.
I want them to be amazing.
And if they're not willing to be amazing,
then... hit the door.

speaker: KELLY
text: I don't know what the woman wants me to say.
I mean, my kids want to be back on the team,
they tried out for the team,
they made it...
They should be on the team.

speaker: JILL
text: So here we are,
we show up to class...
In walks Jaclyn,
straight off of the streets of L.A.
Skinny, skinny, skinny, gorgeous...
but it's obvious she does not fit in
with our team of dance moms.
Well, well, well.
Here we all are again.

speaker: KELLY
text: You know, I've just come to the decision,
as hard as it's gonna be for me to go in there
and kiss up to that woman,
I'm going to do it.
Here's your contract.
Get in there, girls.

speaker: ABBY
text: Kelly hands me her contract without a peep.
There it is, signed, her signature.
Now let's just see if she can keep that mouth shut.
Ladies, last week, we went to a competition in Fort Wayne, Indiana.
There were over a thousand people there
just to see the Abby Lee Dance Company.
While you all were out in the parking lot,
Sophia was in here, learning.
As you can clearly see, we don't have a pyramid here.
Chloe,
Nia,
Maddie,
Mackenzie,
Kendall,
you all realize...
...with the exception of Sophia, that you are on probation.
You are all on the same playing field.

speaker: KELLY
text: Abby chooses one kid in the studio that she focuses on.
Now Maddie did something to piss Abby off,
and now she's moving on to somebody else.
That's what all of you wanted.
You didn't like the pyramid, moms.
You want all the kids to be treated equal.
That's what you got.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Chloe's worked her butt off for Abby,
and she won a national title,
and now Abby's gonna replace her with some girl off the street?
Jackie, you're okay with your kid being a winner.
I know that I can count on her,
that she's a team player.
And, Jackie, I watched you in the dressing room.
I watched you help everybody with their hair.
I watched you be kind to all the other women,
and I appreciate that.

speaker: KELLY
text: Jackie seems like she's this perfect mom,
but I've heard a lot of things about her,
and I don't know, she doesn't seem so perfect.
This week, we are going to Ohio.
The group routine is called "Red Carpet Special."
It's a really sassy, hot, funky number.
Sophia,
you are doing a solo called "Superstar."
I think you did an outstanding job last week,
and I want to see a repeat of the same thing.
It is not fair that Sophia gets a solo this week.
Our girls work their butts off, and they die for solos every week.
How many turns do you do?
Fifty-four.
Why do I want somebody that can only do 53?
I would prefer not to take any other solos,
but I committed to attend the competition,
so we're going.
Not one of these kids deserves a solo,
but I have no choice.
So I'm gonna take my national champion
and see how much she's regressed.
My next solo will be... Chloe.
It's contemporary.
You are the national titleholder,
and you want to keep it up?
Then you have to keep winning.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Surprise, surprise, Abby gives Chloe a solo,
not as a reward, but as a punishment,
because she's gonna make her dance against Sophia.
I want to direct my attention to the moms.
I need to see your loyalty
for what I'm doing for your children.
You will have assignments, and you're gonna do a whole lot more
than sit on your butts upstairs in my studio.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Did she forget that we're the ones who pay her to teach our kids dance?
We have other children and other responsibilities,
and you are not in charge of us.

speaker: ABBY
text: Ooh. Who has their nose up in the air?
They need to volunteer a little bit, and if they don't want to,
out the door.
âª

speaker: ABBY
text: Ladies, spread apart.
We have lots of work to do.
This is all about being superstars.
Being celebrities.
Being on the red carpet.
Everybody wants to take your picture.
Everybody wants your autograph.
So that's what the piece is about.
You know, this team, they think they're all back together again.
I was left with absolutely no team.
Sophia stepped in and saved the day.
She's a star, and they all better get used to it.
Be grateful that Sophia has come to Pittsburgh
and joined our group.
It's like going from... mediocre to flying first class.

speaker: CHLOE
text: Miss Abby kept saying how much... how much better Sophia was than all of us,
and that gave me a purpose to work really hard
to show Miss Abby one day I will be as good as Sophia.
I-I wanted to see... how many pirouettes? 58?
I think she can do 54.
- Fifty-four. - In tap shoes.
I want to see it.

speaker: KELLY
text: That's a reflection on the teacher.
Like, she can say to our kids "You can't turn,"
but she doesn't like when I say to her,
"Well, you can't teach them to turn then."
Obviously, 'cause my kids have been here
since they've been two and a half.
- I think she's fabulous. - Right.
And she's gonna beat our kids every time.
We understand that.

speaker: KELLY
text: Melissa and Christi, they're not feeling so welcoming to this woman.
Get used to it.
Your kid's not always gonna be the best.

speaker: JILL
text: Why do you need to do 58 pirouettes in tap shoes?
There's a world record, continuous pirouettes.
So, is she a world record holder?
She consistently can break the record.
Look, all these girls are really good.
They're all stars.
Jaclyn's trying really hard to come across as the picture-perfect mom,
and the dance mom who doesn't get involved in all the drama,
but I have friends in California, too,
and they have warned me about her.
She's not all she seems.
I read some of the things that you wrote online
about a little girl named Mia in Miami, and it wasn't very kind.
So I'm glad that you're at least being kind to our children.
I would never write anything about Mia.
Oh, it was written from you about a little girl in Miami
who you said-- who is amazing--
who you said, "Who cares?
"Why another contest about her?
"She's not even that good."
- I didn't write that. - So I'm just grateful...
Well, okay, then I must have faulty reading.
No, I heard that, too, actually.
Yeah, but you know, you hear a lot of things, but that's not true.

speaker: ABBY
text: Chloe, listen to me.
The name of the music is "Another Girl."
Whether the other girl's in your mind,
whether she really exists,
whether it's you...
I know Chloe can relate to this.
This song, "Another Girl," is about being left
in the shadows of some kid that's famous and popular.
First it was Maddie, now it's Sophia.
Up, ball change, step up.
Okay. You got that? All right, I'll be back.
I have an acro private, but I'll come back during the whole break. Okay?
Abby's already made it abundantly clear
that Sophia's the only person that matters,
but to cut Chloe's solo rehearsal short to have an acro private with Sophia
is simply below the belt.
Abby thinks she's an amazing superstar,
and she loves her, and they have this great relationship,
and she's a breath of fresh air, blah, blah, blah,
but our kids have been beaten down for years.
I think this is one week that Melissa and Maddie are thinking,
- "Thank God." - "Thank God, I don't have a solo."
Melissa and Abby are buddy-buddy,
and everybody knows that Melissa will do whatever it takes
to have her kids number one in Abby's eyes.
Oh, yeah, that is over, Chloe.
âª
What are you people doing?
I've probably cleaned this place out 12 times 'cause it was filthy.
Being Abby's slaves?
And Melissa, you're taking out garbage?
I always do anyway, even when I do...
Melissa, don't take out the garbage.
- I always did. - Don't.

speaker: MELISSA
text: Maddie and Mackenzie were always Abby's favorite.
And if I have to take the trash out
or clean outside, um, I'm fine with that because
I just don't want Abby to be mad at us anymore.
Back walkover to one knee. Simple.
[squeaky] Arms up by your ears.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: We need to do some sort of initiation at competition.
Like what?
Well, she's really good like, she's good at guarding.
Like, Jill, I could get a little at,
you know, and she'd... [speaks gibberish]
This one's a little bit more like, she's well-practiced.
I think everyone here is a little annoyed that Jackie waltzes in, you know,
with her perfect little dancer and their perfect little costumes,
and their perfect little makeup.
I don't think anybody would be overly annoyed
if they packed up their perfect little suitcases and hit the road.
I don't know what we could do.
I'm not good at that kind of stuff.
Oh, we could put E-6000 in her eyelash glue
'cause she's wearing eyelashes.
Oh, my God, we can't do that.
My God, she could go blind.
I want her to be a triple threat and then some.
What can we do to her?
She's gonna do tumbling, she's gonna do acrobatics,
she's gonna do contortion work.
We could roofie her drink.
Oh, God! No!
My God! You're mean!
I'm not gonna, like, roofie her and have her have to go
to the hospital and get her stomach pumped.
You're evil!
Maybe I'm just going 'cause I've been roofied before.

speaker: ABBY
text: Girls...
you're supposed to be in A. Gianna's already in there. Let's go.
Come on. I don't know why you're acting like it's a picnic.
We're gonna be on a bus in a few hours, going to a competition.
I am really nervous about this week's competition.
To get five kids who have been sitting in a parking lot
back in the studio and back in sync with each other,
that is my goal.
And right now, they're all over the place.
So I guess Abby didn't get a good night's sleep.
She was a little crabby this morning.
I think Abby needs more than a good night's sleep.
She needs a good roll in the hay!
That's exactly what I'm saying, Jill.
Ribs right, left. Right, left.
Is Abby married now?
I said, "Maybe if Abby was thin, she could find a man,"
and Kelly's response was, "It doesn't matter how thin she is,
"she's still a giant bitch."
Oh!

speaker: KELLY
text: I think Abby's actually very pretty.
- She... Yeah. - It's her... it's her attitude.
Gianna, do you think you can run up and tell
Sophia's mom that I really want her to watch
and not be chitchatting with the other moms?
I think that Sophia has been sent to me by the dance Gods.
My moms drove one kid after another away from my company.
I've had it. It's not gonna happen with these new moms.
Not on my watch.
Would you want to live with her?
Abby just wanted to make sure that you were watching the warm-up.
Okay. All right. Thank you.
All right, Sophia, you're up.
âª I'll be dancing on the floor... âª
âª âª

speaker: ABBY
text: This number is jam-packed full of difficulty.
And Sophia uses that face, she uses that style
she hits every accent in the music.
Really have to stretch that knee. Feel like I'm pulling it.

speaker: MADDIE
text: It's kind of hard not to be jealous of her when I watch her
because even though she's my age...
she can do 54 turns, and I can't.
So, do you get up every morning and do the stretches before she goes to school?
She goes to homeschool.
- I know, but you take her to school? - I do, yeah.
Right now, we're going Mondays and Fridays.
That's all you have to go to school, two days?
Between two to four, yeah.
You're killing me over here.
- Holly's the educator. - I know.
I will make sure we have at least two hours before we go to dance.
So, like, if she goes to school from 9:00 to 11:00,
then I'll get her home by 11:30,
and then she stretches from 11:30 to 1:30
and we'll have a 2:00 rehearsal.
Every day.
Sophia only goes to school two hours a week.
Our girls actually go to school full-time, and then they come to dance.
It's kinda sad.
Thanks for doing your turns for us.
- Yep. - I appreciate it.
I'm really serious.
I think that I'm gonna ask you and your mom
if you could do a senior company turn class.
When I... but...
sometimes I'll teach the little kids at our studio,
and I'm really mean to them.
- You're really mean? - Yeah.
I like mean.
I'm really mean, too.
Moms!
Yes?

speaker: ABBY
text: I let these kids back on my team.
Now the least their mothers can do
is roll up their sleeves and do a little work for me.
Where are the counts for the pictures?
We didn't count them because you have staff members
that you pay to do your job.
We pay you to teach our kids dance.
Christi, can you really not count that high?
No, I can't, Abby.
See? I'm the product of a public school.
Good thing I wasn't homeschooled.
I wouldn't be able to even count to ten.

speaker: KELLY
text: Oh, my God, like, Christi is not giving up on Jackie.
She's calling her out on being homeschooled?
I just think Christi doesn't want her on the team.
âª The days are shorter... âª
She's choreographing again, 30 minutes before we get on the bus.
I did not realize that. I thought it was finished.
That gives me anxiety.
No, no, we learn on the day we leave.
- In this case... - Hello.
My daughter's learning her solo when we're going to get on a bus.
It's not three days before, it's the day of.
Abby is clearing setting Chloe up to fail.
She knows that none of the girls on our team
are even at the same level as Sophia.
âª âª
Shoulders down!
My daughter looks defeated.

speaker: HOLLY
text: Why is she... Do you think she's upset?
Yeah, I know she is. Look at her. She's trying...

speaker: MELISSA
text: Yep. She's fighting it.

speaker: CHLOE
text: I'm feeling pressure to go up against Sophia
since she's a very good dancer.
Now I feel like I have to work especially hard
so that I don't let down the group.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Took what out on you?
I'm sorry that you get the brunt.
I'm sorry that all of you guys get the brunt of it.
You don't deserve it. You're little girls.
I am sorry that Abby takes out her anger with me on you.
That's not fair.
Abby, I hate to break it to you,
But if you really have a problem with us not doing all your little tasks,
you need to come to us and stop sending messages through our children.
Don't go in the den and sit and talk.
If you can't control your own mouth, come into A and start working.
Gianna was in here that whole time waiting for you.
And you're in the den, sitting, talking... [gibbering]
You're gonna be going to a competition
where there's some of the best schools you ever compete against.
People that did the group dance are not good enough.
So you need to step up your game or bow out gracefully.
They look nervous to me.

speaker: MELISSA
text: Yeah. You know what?
I thought so, too, from the get-go.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Yeah, there's something going on out there 'cause they're all like...

speaker: ABBY
text: Moms!
- Oh, geez. - Oh, my God.
I don't want to judge.
The kids look horrible.
They can't even do the choreography I'm giving them.
And I have way too many kids in this number. It's a mess.
There are too many people in this dance.
We are auditioning for this routine.
You're gonna play casting director.
So you are looking for the best team to go out on stage and do this routine.
She cuts Maddie and Mackenzie--
I think they're gonna be devastated.
If you're casting a five-year-old,
maybe you're just gonna keep Mackenzie.
If you're casting The Lion King,
maybe the only one you're gonna keep is Nia.
Here we go again with Abby typecasting Nia.
Are they drawing your eye because they were amazing,
or are they drawing your eye because they were late
or they were sloppy?
Of course, anybody watching their own daughters dance
are gonna pick their daughters.
They have them on this team
because they want them to compete.
So of course we're not gonna tell you to take our kid
out of the group dance for the competition.
I mean, we'd be stupid.
âª âª
âª
Christi could not...
would not...
look at Sophia.
Christi, if you want to sit there and not watch that kid
and pretend that she doesn't exist, that's stupid.
- That's stupid. - I was watching.
You can't command where my eyeballs went.
I don't want to command anything.
I'm just telling you that you're foolish not to learn from people
that are better than you.
That's how you get better.
Brooke, you just seem like a day late and a dollar short.
Maddie, I think before Sophia was here,
you hit those accents.
Mackenzie, it's fine.
It's good. It's on par.
I need to think about what's best for the group.
If I ask each of your mothers who they think should be in the dance first,
they're all gonna say each of your names.
Even though they may think differently, they're gonna go with their own kid.
They cannot be objective, can you?
No.
Brooke, you're out.

speaker: KELLY
text: Mackenzie's smaller than them,
and she's not at the same technical level as them.
So, to me, it would only make sense to get rid of Mackenzie.
But of course, she's gonna get rid of my kid because she hates me.
I just want to let y'all know
I think some of your kids are in a little bit of trouble this weekend.
We're getting on a bus.
We are going to a competition.
There are going to be people there doing their routines from last year.
Everyone is out to beat the Abby Lee Dance Company.
I don't think Sophia should be worried.
I think that group dance should be worried.
I think the soloist should be worried.

speaker: HOLLY
text: I think it's been a very tense few days.
Your fault. Your fault. Your fault.
- No. - Your fault. Your fault. Yes.
Maybe if Abby hadn't replaced Brooke and Paige, you know,
we wouldn't have had to protest.
We wouldn't have had to sit in the parking lot.
She wouldn't have had to bring in a replacement team,
and our girls would be prepared this week.
I think everyone here is thankful for the experience that they have had
and for the dance training. Our children dance.
They don't know how lucky they are.
But pointing fingers right now is really not getting us anywhere,
and trying to belittle children by saying they're ungrateful...
- They are. - They are not.
- They don't even know what they have. - That's-that's...
I don't need to belittle your children.
They do it all on their own.
Shut your mouth!
We have pulled out miracles making these kids look good.
Let's just go.
Let's stop fighting and try to be a team just for this weekend.
You came in at a really tense time.
âª
Hey! Thank you for coming! Thank you!
Whoa.
I'm nervous, and I don't like to be nervous.
We're going back to In10sity Dance,
but it's in Ohio.
Some of the toughest schools in the country are in Ohio,
and we're coming in with a brand-new number with a new dancer.
Am I out of my mind?
Yes, some would say
that I am out of my mind.
Girls, listen.
Those kids recognize you because you are national champions.
